title: No alternative to vaccine passports, says Dubai airport boss
description: Dubai is the world's busiest airport and its boss says vaccine passports will get us flying again.

title: Covid: A tenth of Britain's restaurants lost during pandemic
description: As bars, pubs and restaurants prepare to welcome customers back indoors, some will not reopen at all.

title: Driving Japan's first bullet trains
description: The world's fastest ever train was launched in Japan in 1964.

title: The mid-air walkways saving endangered animals
description: Conservationists have built an ingenious system to help the endangered Javan slow loris.

title: Israel-Palestinian conflict: False and misleading claims fact-checked
description: We examine false and misleading claims from both sides that have been shared widely on social media.

title: Torlonia marbles: 'The priceless statues I saw covered in dust and dirt'
description: For years a priceless sculpture collection lay hidden behind a door on the staircase leading to David Willey's flat.

title: Covid economy: What economists got right (and wrong)
description: A year ago, the US economy tanked. Will it return to normal once the pandemic is over?

title: Herdwicks: The 'smiley' sheep that shaped the Lake District
description: Saved from demise by Beatrix Potter, the Herdwick breed is synonymous with the lakes' landscape.

title: Chelsea women: Why Emma Hayes is the driving force behind success
description: The Chelsea women's coach is hoping for a historic win in tonight's Champions League final.

title: How do you convince people to have babies?
description: As China and the US look set to shrink in population, what can they do to encourage people to procreate?

title: Ben Kielesinski: The man who took the world on an adventure
description: Throughout Covid Ben Kielesinski has taken his TikTok followers on trips around Vancouver.

title: Fostering: ‘I have fostered more than 60 children
description: Patricia Gray always wanted to help other children - but there's a warning fewer people are fostering.

title: Lockdown easing: Virus experts tell us what they will (and won't) be doing
description: How will scientists use their new-found freedoms when Covid restrictions are eased on Monday?

title: Frankie Morris: Three arrested after teen's disappearance
description: Frantisek "Frankie" Morris, 18, was last seen near the Vaynol Arms, Pentir, Gwynedd, on 2 May.

title: Chelsea 0-1 Leicester: Gary Lineker & James Maddison go wild for Youri Tielemans screamer
description: Watch as Gary Lineker and James Maddison react to Youri Tielemans FA Cup screamer as Leicester City lifted the trophy for the first time in their history with victory over Chelsea at Wembley.

title: 'So happy I can't begin to describe it' - Leicester revel in first FA Cup triumph
description: Leicester captain Kasper Schmeichel says his joy at leading them to a first-ever FA Cup is "indescribable" after beating Chelsea.

title: Beverley bullocks: Escaped cattle seen grazing in gardens
description: The cattle, which had wandered from nearby fields, were later rounded up and returned home.

title: Israel-Gaza conflict rages as US envoy visits
description: Israeli and Palestinian leaders are urged to stop firing as civilian casualties mount.

title: Santander customers unable to access online accounts
description: The bank says it is working to resolve problems with its services, but it does not have a timescale.

title: ‘It’s starting to feel real, I’m ready’ – Alex Scott to host Football Focus
description: Alex Scott describes her pride and excitement at taking over as the new presenter of Football Focus.

title: Universal basic income to be tested in Wales
description: It means adults regardless of income, will be given money to cover essential living costs.

title: Covid in Scotland: Police urge large Rangers crowds to disperse
description: Hundreds of supporters gathered outside Ibrox Stadium to celebrate their club's Scottish Premiership title triumph.

title: Covid: Plea to get the jab in variant hotspot areas
description: Eligible people in areas where the Indian virus variant is spreading are urged to get vaccinated.

title: Royal British Legion: Wreath-laying marks centenary
description: Ceremony at the Cenotaph marks exact moment the charity was formed a century ago at 09:00 BST.

title: Saving my teeth damaged by years of domestic abuse
description: A domestic abuse charity is matching dentists who want to help survivors needing urgent dental work.

title: How Israel's Iron Dome missile shield works
description: The Israeli military says the Iron Dome is intercepting about 90% of the rockets fired from Gaza.

title: GB's Yee fourth in opening round of World Triathlon Series
description: Britain's Alex Yee finishes fourth in the opening round of the 2021 World Triathlon Series in Yokohama, with Tom Bishop 22nd and Jonny Brownlee 23rd.

title: Is there a future for Alex Salmond?
description: The former Scottish first minister and SNP leader gambled on a breakaway new party and lost. Is this the end?

title: FA Cup final: How Leicester fans are marking the match
description: The team's first FA Cup final in years will be emotional for those with tickets and those without.

title: Covid: First Australian repatriation flight from India lands in Darwin
description: Many of the intended passengers on the repatriation flight were barred after positive Covid tests.

title: China lands its Zhurong rover on Mars
description: The six-wheeled robot has made the hazardous descent to the surface of the Red Planet, China announces.

title: Israeli-Palestinian conflict gives Biden foreign policy headache
description: The US president and his aides wish to avoid being drawn into this graveyard of US-led peace initiatives.
